metadata.title: CVE-2019-19965 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 5.4.6, there is a NULL pointer dereference indrivers/scsi/libsas/sas_discover.c because of mishandling of portdisconnection during discovery, related to a PHY down race condition, akaCID-f70267f379b5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19965` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-kvm - 4.4.0-1066.73
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.113
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1060-aws - 4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-gcp - 4.15.0-1055.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1033-oracle - 4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1129.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1133.141
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.138').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
